byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: South Carolina Senate votes, 37-3, to remove Confederate battle flag from grounds of State House; massacre at Charleston’s Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church revived issue that had previously fractured legislature; bipartisan vote to remove flag is landmark moment that many see as sign of a resounding and abrupt shift throughout South Carolina toward view that flag is symbol of segregation and white supremacy.
lead_paragraph: The bipartisan proposal to remove a lasting symbol of the Confederacy from State House grounds now moves to the State House of Representatives.

headline.main: South Carolina’s Senators Take Step to Remove the Confederate Flag
